text: Hafez al-Assad (; 6 October 1930 â€“ 10 June 2000) served as the 18th president of Syria from 1971 until his death of a heart attack in 2000. He was also the general of Syrian Air Force from 1955 - 1972. He was born in Qardaha and died in Damascus.Encyclopaedia Britannica He had four sons and a daughter. His eldest son Bassel al-Assad died in 1994. He was succeeded as president by his second-oldest son Bashar al-Assad (born 1965). == References == Category:1930 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Former dictators Category:Prime ministers of Syria Category:Presidents of Syria Category:Syrian generals Category:20th-century presidents in Asia
title: Hafez al-Assad
